documents.title: README
documents.content:
# .clawvault

An elephant never forgets.

## Structure

### Memory Categories
- `preferences/` — Likes, dislikes, how I want things
- `decisions/` — Choices made with context and reasoning
- `patterns/` — Recurring behaviors (→ lessons)
- `people/` — Relationships, one file per person
- `projects/` — Active work, ventures, ongoing efforts
- `goals/` — Long-term and short-term objectives
- `transcripts/` — Session summaries and logs
- `inbox/` — Quick capture → process later
- `lessons/` — What I learned, insights, patterns observed
- `agents/` — Other agents — capabilities, trust levels, coordination notes
- `commitments/` — Promises, goals, obligations to fulfill
- `handoffs/` — Session bridges — what I was doing, what comes next
- `research/` — Deep dives, analysis, reference material

### Work Tracking
- `tasks/` — Active work items with status and context
- `backlog/` — Future work — ideas and tasks not yet started

### Observational Memory
- `ledger/raw/` — Raw session transcripts (source of truth)
- `ledger/observations/` — Compressed observations with importance scores
- `ledger/reflections/` — Weekly reflection summaries

## Quick Reference

```bash
# Capture a thought
clawvault capture "important insight about X"

# Store structured memory
clawvault store --category decisions --title "Choice" --content "We chose X because..."

# Search
clawvault search "query"
clawvault vsearch "semantic query"    # vector search

# Knowledge graph
clawvault graph                       # vault stats
clawvault context "topic"             # graph-aware context retrieval

# Session lifecycle
clawvault checkpoint --working-on "task"
clawvault sleep "what I did" --next "what's next"
clawvault wake                        # restore context on startup
```

---

*Managed by [ClawVault](https://clawvault.dev)*

documents.title: marks-api-keys
documents.content:
# Mark's API Keys & Auth — TODO

Keys/credentials Clawdine needs. Do these when you have 20 minutes.

## 1. X/Twitter API Keys
- Go to https://developer.x.com → create a project/app
- Account: @Clawdine_shoe (or your own, either works)
- Need: API Key, API Secret, Access Token, Access Token Secret, Bearer Token
- Free tier is fine (read-only)
- Store: `security add-generic-password -a clawdine -s "x-api-key" -w "KEY"` (repeat for each)

## 2. AgentMail API Key
- Inbox exists: `clawdine@agentmail.to` (ID: `19120325619`)
- Was working Feb 10, key lost in compaction
- Get from: https://agentmail.to dashboard
- Store: `security add-generic-password -a clawdine -s "agentmail-api-key" -w "KEY"`

## 3. Google OAuth (for gog CLI / Gmail)
- Go to Google Cloud Console → APIs & Services → Credentials
- Create OAuth 2.0 Client ID (Desktop app)
- Download `client_secret.json`
- Then run: `gog auth credentials /path/to/client_secret.json`
- Then: `gog auth add markmusson@gmail.com --services gmail`

## 4. GitHub Repo for Workspace Backup
- Create private repo (e.g. `clawdine-workspace`)
- Then I'll set up git remote + daily push

## Optional
- **OpenRouter API Key** — cost reduction lever, routes cheaper models
  - Get from: https://openrouter.ai
  - Store: `security add-generic-password -a clawdine -s "openrouter-api-key" -w "KEY"`

documents.title: clawdsure-causal
documents.content: ClawdSure = telematics box for AI agents. Daily cryptographically signed, hash-linked attestation chain. Domain: causal.insure. Two paths to market: Greenlight (Lloyd's syndicate DA) or Daren's regulated entity. DeFi yield on insurance float. Vercel AI SDK = bigger market than OpenClaw alone.

documents.title: owasp-ai-exchange
documents.content: OWASP AI Exchange (owaspai.org) is the real standards reference, NOT 'OWASP Agentic Top 10 2026' (hallucinated by sub-agent). 300+ pages, OWASP Flagship, CC0 licensed. Threat taxonomy maps to attestation checks.

documents.title: sam-clifton
documents.content: Sam Clifton @ Greenlightre. Reinsurer, risk capital/capacity, Lloyd's syndicate. Very keen to hear more (Feb 12). Lunch being scheduled. Key contact for Causal Tier 2 delegated authority.

documents.title: daren-mccauley
documents.content: Daren McCauley. Actuary, ex-CEO of insurer behind Humn. Has regulated entity. Potential delegated authority/regulatory wrapper for Causal.

documents.title: sub-agents-lie
documents.content: Never send sub-agent output directly to Mark or external recipients. Always rewrite in voice. Sub-agents produce technically-correct-but-obviously-AI prose. Verified Feb 14 when DESIGN.md needed full rewrite from 37KB to 16KB.

documents.title: Welcome to .clawvault
documents.content:
# Welcome to .clawvault

Your vault is ready. Here's what you can do:

## Quick Start

- **Capture a thought:** `clawvault capture "your note here"`
- **Store structured memory:** `clawvault store --category decisions --title "My Choice" --content "..."`
- **Search your vault:** `clawvault search "query"`
- **See your knowledge graph:** `clawvault graph`
- **Get context for a topic:** `clawvault context "topic"`

## Vault Structure

Your vault organizes memories by type — decisions, lessons, people, projects, and more.
Each category is a folder. Each memory is a markdown file with frontmatter.

## Observational Memory

When connected to an AI agent (like OpenClaw), your vault can automatically observe
conversations and extract important memories — decisions, lessons, commitments — without
manual effort.

## Wiki-Links

Use `[[double brackets]]` to link between notes. Your memory graph tracks these
connections, building a knowledge network that grows with you.

---

*Delete this file anytime. It's just here to say hello.*

documents.title: Core priorities
documents.content: Priority stack: ClawdSure > Roundy > Trading > Nightjar > LinkedIn. Sub-agents lie — verify everything.

documents.title: git-backup
documents.content: Mark needs to create GitHub repo for workspace backup. CRITICAL — currently zero backups. Keep nudging.

documents.title: trading-portfolio
documents.content: 3 open positions totaling ~.12 at risk, ~/bin/zsh.08 cash. All-time realized P/L: -.99. Seoul NO won (+.24, 28.2%). Wellington NO lost (-.07). NYC pending. Wellington Feb 14 + Miami Feb 14 open.

documents.title: causal-not-cyber
documents.content: Causal is NOT cyber insurance (Sam Clifton, Feb 14). Two capped tiers. Tier 1 = parametric-like B2C (gadget insurance). Tier 2 = SME with daily telematics. Exclude enterprise. Linux in 1994 = new asset class.
